header_summary: Antoine Riard's email explores the challenges and potential solutions for off-chain constructions, including liquidity unbalance, fault-tolerance, scalability, and security concerns. He also questions the effectiveness of OP_EVICT in an off-chain payment pool and proposes alternative solutions. Vincenzo Palazzo raises concerns about the grammar specification of BIP 21 and suggests improvements. Tony Giorgio discusses decorrelated payments and asks for feedback on a research write-up. Lloyd Fournier mentions a downside to using a MuSig API. Vincenzo Palazzo acknowledges an error in a previous post and provides the correct link.

recent_posts.title: Scaling Lightning With Simple Covenants
recent_posts.summary:
- Antoine discusses off-chain constructions, including Lightning's liquidity unbalance and on-chain splicing for scalability.
- He addresses the challenge of getting casual users to sign transactions and suggests cryptographic accumulators for scalability.
- Antoine points out the lack of fault-tolerance in timeout-trees and highlights the importance of fault-tolerance in payment pool advancements.

recent_posts.title: Solving CoinPool high-interactivity issue with cut-through update of Taproot leaves
recent_posts.summary:

- Antoine questions the best direction to address high interactivity in channel factory and payment pool.

recent_posts.summary:

active_posts.title: Blinded 2-party Musig2
active_posts.summary:
- The implementation of 2-of-2 Schnorr Musig2 for statechains is blind to the server.
- Blinding in statechains relies on trusting the server's reported number of partial signatures.
- The process involves generating keys, aggregating them, and computing the final signature.

active_posts.title: Concern about "Inscriptions"
active_posts.summary:
- The question of blockchain storage sufficiency can be answered affirmatively based on several factors.
- In a worst-case scenario, the blockchain growth would be 210.24GB per year.
- Affordable hardware and ongoing optimization efforts ensure sufficient storage for practical blockchain usage.

active_posts.title: Concrete MATT opcodes
active_posts.summary:
- Salvatore Ingala has presented a comprehensive proposal for the core opcodes of MATT.
- The proposal includes a revised and improved implementation of the opcode in the bitcoin-inquisition repo.
- The new opcode is OP_CHECKCONTRACTVERIFY (CCV) and includes additional parameters for input/output operations.

active_posts.title: Scaling Lightning With Simple Covenants
active_posts.summary:
- The email discusses the challenge of scaling Lightning channels for casual users.
- Simple covenants and timeout-trees are proposed as solutions to improve Lightning's scalability.
- Enabling these mechanisms can make Lightning more widely used for off-chain payments.

active_posts.title: Resumable channels using OP_CHECKSIGFROMSTACK
active_posts.summary:
- The proposal suggests a new way to make lightning channels resumable from a wallet seed.
- It introduces a new type of channel funding transaction with additional spending path.
- The proposal also includes fraud proofs to detect revoked states and suggests saving bandwidth.

active_posts.title: Remotely control your lightning node from your favorite HSM
active_posts.summary:
- Bastien has submitted a pull request to document an idea for securely sending administrative commands to a lightning node.
- The architecture uses a hardware security module as a whitelisted lightning peer.
- Bastien proposes implementing the idea with minimal changes to the lightning node and offers assistance.
